question_sentence: The brains of which animal have been ‘hijacked’ to help sniff out bombs in tests by US researchers?
The latest annual Femicide Census shows that what percentage of women killed by men in the UK were murdered by a former or current partner?
Home Secretary Priti Patel reportedly tried to oust which senior member of her department?
At which London mosque was a man in his 70s stabbed while leading the call to prayer?
Which of these explanations was NOT offered by Pakistani officials for the sudden deaths of 14 people in a Karachi neighbourhood this week?
choices: Leak of toxic gas methyl bromide

question_sentence: Which wannabe US presidential candidate made their Democratic debate debut in Las Vegas this week?
Which Downing Street figure called for the NHS to pay for “designer babies” in a newly uncovered 2014 blog post?
Where did the UK place in the Tax Justice Network’s latest rankings of the world’s most secretive financial systems?
The Royal Mail has released a new set of stamps to celebrate which 2020 film?
Which artist won Album of the Year at the 2020 Brit Awards?
Which university waived tuition this week for families making less than $80,000 a year?
choices: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
evidence: USC announced Thursday that families with an annual income of $80,000 or less can attend the private university tuition-free, starting with students entering their first year this fall. Owning a home will also no longer be considered when determining a student's financial need, the school said.

question_sentence: Football player Gregory Robinson was arrested this week for allegedly possessing 157 pounds of marijuana. What team does Robinson play for?
evidence: Robinson, an offensive tackle for the Browns, will be an unrestricted free agent next month. He was charged in a federal complaint with conspiracy to possess with intent to distribute marijuana and possession intent to distribute

question_sentence: Larry Tesler died this week at the age of 74. He was the creator of which popular keyboard function?
evidence: Tesler was a pioneer of personal computing credited with creating the cut, copy and paste as well as the search and replace functions. He played an early, central role in making computers accessible.

question_sentence: Which former governor did President Donald Trump grant clemency to this week?
evidence: Trump granted clemency to former Illinois Gov. Rod Blagojevich. He served eight years of a 14-year prison sentence after being accused of attempting to sell a US senate seat.

question_sentence: Which diet was found by a new study to improve brain function and prevent the development of chronic diseases such as diabetes and cancer?
evidence: A study published Monday found that following the Mediterranean diet, which consists of lots of fruits, vegetables, nuts and fish, and little red meat and sugar altered the microbiome of elderly people in ways that would aid in longevity.

question_sentence: Which home furnishings retailer filed for bankruptcy this week?
evidence: Pier 1, which has closed hundreds of stores in recent years, filed for bankruptcy Monday.

question_sentence: When do scientists think all of Earth’s coral reef habitats will be destroyed by climate change?
evidence: Scientists from the University of Hawaii Manoa warn that by 2100, “few to zero suitable coral habitats will remain.” The crisis can only be averted if “we take drastic action on climate change,” researchers said.

question_sentence: The Chinese government expelled three reporters from which news outlet this week?
evidence: The Chinese government revoked the press credentials of three Wall Street Journal reporters over an opinion piece that criticized China’s initial reaction to the novel coronavirus outbreak.

question_sentence: Which comedians are performing at this year's White House Correspondents' Dinner?
evidence: Hasan Minhaj, who performed at the dinner in 2017, will return for this year's event on Saturday, April 25, 2020.The association also announced another comedian as the host for the evening: Kenan Thompson.

question_sentence: NASCAR driver Ryan Newman was released from the hospital Wednesday, just two days after his terrifying crash during the last lap of which race?
evidence: Ryan Newman, leading the final lap of NASCAR's Daytona 500, was involved in a fiery crash Monday that saw his car spin and go airborne, flipping several times. On Wednesday, Roush Fenway Racing tweeted a photo of Newman walking out of the hospital with his two daughters.
